about_club.prompt: The UBC Kung Fu Club is the oldest martial arts club at the University of British Columbia. Here, we focus on learning the application and culture of martial arts, as well as maintaining a healthy body and mind.
about_club.classes: We offer classes in three different types of kung fu: wushu, sanshou and lion dance. All experience levels are welcome! Many of our members are beginners.
about_club.demos: You can also book a wushu performance or lion dance from our club!

class_info.prompt: We offer three types of kung fu classes: sanshou, wushu and lion dance.

sanshou_class.paragraph1: Sanshou, also known as sanda, is a Chinese self-defense system and also a combat sport. Sanshou (pronounced san-show) refers to free fighting skills and literally means "free hands". A traditional Sanshou fighter is proficient in ti (kicking), da (striking), shuai (take-downs) and na (grappling).

wushu_class.paragraph1: Wushu literally translates into "martial arts". With this generic definition you can use wushu to describe a whole range of martial arts. In our case, wushu is a discipline that has its earliest and most recognized root from Shao Lin. It consists of tens of thousands of different external and internal styles with some well known styles such as shaolin quan, taiji quan, xingyi quan and many more. Wushu has become a popular international sport that everyone can learn and use to attain its inherent benefits such as improving one's health, balance, flexibility, coordination, speed, reaction time and power.
wushu_class.paragraph2: Forms, also known as taolu, is comprised of martial arts patterns that contains gymnastics and contemporary dance components. The forms are composed of basic stances, kicks, punches, sweeps, balances, and acrobatic movements in the traditional Chinese martial art style and can be altered to highlight one's strengths and potentials.

lion_dance.paragraph1: Lion Dance is a form of traditional dance in the Chinese culture in which two performers mimic a lion's movement inside a lion costume. A lion is composed of two people and is performed in rhythm with an additional drum, cymbal, and gong. Lion Dance is performed mainly during festivals in the Chinese New Year to spread good luck, prosperity, longevity, and fortune. Our lion dance classes emphasize teamwork and coordination. After all, it takes two people to dance in the lion!

demo_inquiry.prompt: We perform lion dances and wushu demonstrations for various occasions, both on and off the UBC campus. Some examples include UBC club events, weddings, store openings, festivals and other celebrations. You can have lion dance performances at virtually any event, as there is no such thing as too much good luck.
